content:
The `mouseEvents` list defines various mouse interaction events including clicks and drags with different modifier keys (shift, control, alt). These events are used for user input handling in a Direct3D rendering context. The chunk is placed within the DisplayRegionManager class to manage mouse event tracking across multiple display regions.

self.mouseEvents = ['mouse1', 'mouse1-up',
                            'shift-mouse1', 'shift-mouse1-up',
                            'control-mouse1', 'control-mouse1-up',
                            'alt-mouse1', 'alt-mouse1-up',
                            'mouse2', 'mouse2-up',
                            'shift-mouse2', 'shift-mouse2-up',
                            'control-mouse2', 'control-mouse2-up',
                            'alt-mouse2', 'alt-mouse2-up',
                            'mouse3', 'mouse3-up',
                            'shift-mouse3', 'shift-mouse3-up',
                            'control-mouse3', 'control-mouse3-up',
                            'alt-mouse3', 'alt-mouse3-up',
                            ]
